definitions: barely sufficient or adequate in amount, degree, or extent
lacking in fullness, volume, or development in physical appearance
examples: The report provided scant evidence for the claims
There was scant time to prepare for the meeting
Her scant clothing offered little protection from cold
The recipe calls for scant tablespoon of salt

definitions: small or insufficient in quantity or amount for what is needed
of clothing, revealing more of the body than is considered proper
examples: The scanty rainfall caused severe drought conditions
They survived on scanty rations during the siege
She wore scanty beach attire to the party
The dancers performed in scanty costumes

definitions: insufficient for the demand; not enough to meet needs
rarely found or seen; uncommon in occurrence or frequency
examples: Fresh water became scarce during the drought
Jobs are scarce in this rural area
Such kindness is scarce in today's world
Honest politicians are scarce these days

definitions: feeling frightened or worried about something dangerous or unpleasant
marked or damaged by frightening experiences or showing signs of fear
examples: The scared child hid behind her mother
He felt scared walking alone at night
Her scared expression revealed her true feelings
The scared animal cowered in the corner

definitions: of a bright red color with a slight orange tinge
associated with immoral behavior, particularly sexual impropriety or shame
examples: She wore a beautiful scarlet dress to the gala
The scarlet roses bloomed in the garden
The scarlet woman was shunned by society
His scarlet past haunted his political career

definitions: marked with scars from wounds, burns, or other physical damage
emotionally or psychologically damaged by traumatic experiences or events
examples: His scarred face told stories of past battles
The scarred landscape showed effects of wildfire
She remained scarred by her childhood experiences
The nation was scarred by years of civil war

definitions: causing fear or alarm; frightening in nature or appearance
impressively extreme in degree, amount, or intensity in informal usage
examples: The scary movie kept them awake all night
Walking through the cemetery was scary experience
He drives at scary speeds on the highway
The debt reached scary proportions last year

definitions: severely critical in a way that is intended to hurt or damage
examples: The critic wrote a scathing review of the performance
She delivered a scathing attack on government policy
His scathing remarks left everyone in uncomfortable silence
The report contained scathing criticism of management

definitions: distributed or spread over a wide area rather than concentrated
occurring at irregular intervals or in isolated instances throughout
examples: Scattered papers covered the entire desk surface
The scattered villages dotted the countryside
We expect scattered showers throughout the afternoon
Only scattered applause followed the performance

definitions: having beautiful natural scenery that is pleasant to look at
examples: They drove along the scenic coastal highway
The scenic mountain views attracted many tourists
We stopped at several scenic overlooks during trip
The town offers scenic walks along the river

definitions: having a pleasant smell added through perfume or natural fragrance
having detected or tracked something through sense of smell
examples: She lit several scented candles around the room
The scented soap left her skin smelling fresh
The hound scented prey in the undergrowth
Police dogs scented drugs in the luggage

definitions: having doubts or reservations about something claimed to be true
examples: Scientists remained sceptical about the new findings
She was sceptical of his sudden change
The sceptical audience questioned every claim made
He gave her a sceptical look

definitions: arranged or planned to happen at a particular time or date
examples: The scheduled departure time is three o'clock
All scheduled maintenance was completed on time
Her scheduled appointment was cancelled due to illness
The scheduled meeting will proceed as planned

definitions: represented in simplified form as a diagram showing essential features
following a fixed plan or pattern without creative variation
examples: The engineer drew a schematic diagram of the circuit
The schematic representation helped explain the concept
His schematic approach lacked originality and creativity
The novel follows a schematic plot structure

definitions: making secret plans to achieve something, especially through deception
examples: The scheming politician plotted against his rivals
Her scheming nature made others distrust her
The scheming employees planned to undermine their boss
Behind his smile was a scheming mind

definitions: causing or characterized by division or separation, especially in religious organizations
examples: The schismatic movement split the church in two
His schismatic teachings were condemned by authorities
The schismatic groups refused to recognize papal authority
These schismatic tendencies threaten organizational unity

definitions: characterized by emotional detachment and solitary behavior typical of schizoid personality
having contradictory or incompatible elements existing together unnaturally
examples: His schizoid personality made forming relationships difficult
The patient exhibited schizoid behavioral patterns
The company's schizoid policies confused all employees
Modern life creates schizoid attitudes toward technology

definitions: relating to or suffering from schizophrenia mental disorder
characterized by wildly contradictory or inconsistent elements or behaviors
examples: The schizophrenic patient required specialized medical care
His schizophrenic symptoms worsened without medication
The market showed schizophrenic behavior all week
The film's schizophrenic tone confused many viewers

definitions: involving or relating to serious academic study and research methods
examples: She wrote a scholarly article on medieval history
His scholarly approach impressed the review committee
The scholarly journal published peer-reviewed research papers
They engaged in scholarly debate about the theory

definitions: relating to schools, education, or academic achievement and study
relating to medieval scholasticism philosophy and theological method
examples: Her scholastic achievements earned multiple scholarship offers
The scholastic year begins in early September
The scholastic philosophers debated theological questions endlessly
His scholastic methods seemed outdated to critics

definitions: based on or using the methods and principles of science
systematic and methodical in approach, using careful observation and testing
examples: The scientific evidence supported the new theory
They conducted scientific experiments to test hypotheses
She took a scientific approach to solving problems
His scientific method yielded reliable results

definitions: brilliantly clever, animated, or witty in conversation or performance
sparkling or shining brightly with flashes of light
examples: Her scintillating conversation captivated everyone at dinner
The comedian delivered a scintillating performance
The scintillating diamonds caught everyone's attention
Stars created scintillating patterns in the sky

definitions: burned or damaged by heat or fire on the surface
dried out completely by excessive heat from sun or fire
examples: The scorched wood showed where lightning had struck
Her scorched fingers hurt from touching the pan
The scorched earth yielded no crops that year
Scorched grass covered the drought-stricken lawn

definitions: extremely hot in temperature, enough to cause burning or discomfort
extremely harsh or severe in criticism or verbal attack
examples: The scorching summer heat broke temperature records
They endured scorching temperatures in the desert
She delivered a scorching critique of the proposal
His scorching words left everyone stunned

definitions: having no points scored by either side in a game or match
examples: The game remained scoreless through three quarters
Both teams played scoreless innings
After ninety minutes, the match was still scoreless
The scoreless tie disappointed fans

definitions: rejected or dismissed with contempt or derision by others
examples: The scorned lover sought revenge against him
His scorned proposal was never mentioned again
She felt scorned by her former friends
The scorned ideas later proved revolutionary

definitions: of or relating to Scotland, its people, or products
examples: He poured himself a glass of scotch whisky
The scotch plaid pattern adorned the fabric
They enjoyed scotch broth on cold winter days
The scotch tape held the package together

definitions: cleaned by hard rubbing or scrubbing to remove dirt
searched through thoroughly and carefully looking for something
examples: The scoured pots gleamed in the kitchen
Her scoured hands were raw from cleaning
Police scoured the area for evidence
They scoured records looking for information

definitions: mixed up in a confused or disordered way
of eggs, cooked by stirring while frying
examples: The scrambled signals made communication impossible
His scrambled thoughts showed his confusion
She served scrambled eggs with toast for breakfast
The chef prepared perfectly scrambled eggs

definitions: showing determined fighting spirit despite disadvantages or small size
consisting of disconnected pieces or scraps without coherent organization
examples: The scrappy team never gave up despite losing
Her scrappy attitude helped her succeed
His scrappy notes made little sense later
The scrappy manuscript needed major editing

definitions: rough and irritating to touch or causing itching sensation
producing harsh scratching or rasping sounds
examples: The scratchy wool sweater irritated her skin
His throat felt scratchy from the cold
The old record player produced scratchy music
Her scratchy voice showed she was sick

definitions: making loud, high-pitched cries or sounds of fear or excitement
extremely conspicuous or obvious in appearance or manner
examples: The screaming children ran from the playground
Screaming fans surrounded the celebrity
The screaming headlines announced the scandal
She wore screaming pink to the funeral

definitions: crazy, eccentric, or unconventional in an amusing way
examples: His screwball ideas always entertained the team
The screwball comedy had audiences laughing
She had a screwball sense of humor
Their screwball antics got them in trouble

definitions: written out in advance as a script for performance
carefully planned and rehearsed, lacking natural spontaneity
examples: The actors followed the scripted dialogue precisely
The scripted speech was delivered without emotion
Their scripted responses sounded insincere to reporters
The supposedly spontaneous moment was actually scripted

definitions: relating to or contained in religious scriptures or sacred writings
examples: The priest cited scriptural authority for his position
Her scriptural knowledge impressed the congregation
They sought scriptural guidance for moral decisions
The scriptural passages supported their beliefs

definitions: of inferior quality or value; second-rate or substitute
stunted or inferior in growth, especially of vegetation
examples: The scrub team practiced against the varsity
He was relegated to scrub status
Scrub vegetation covered the barren hillside
The scrub pine trees barely survived

definitions: cleaned thoroughly by hard rubbing with brush or cloth
cancelled or abandoned, especially of planned missions or events
examples: Her scrubbed face glowed with cleanliness
The scrubbed floors sparkled in sunlight
The launch was scrubbed due to weather
They scrubbed their vacation plans

definitions: covered with low, stunted trees or bushes
shabby, unkempt, or inferior in appearance
examples: The scrubby landscape offered little shade
Scrubby bushes dotted the desert floor
His scrubby beard needed trimming badly
The scrubby little dog looked neglected

definitions: shabby and untidy in appearance; unkempt or poorly groomed
examples: His scruffy appearance shocked the interview panel
The scruffy dog wandered the streets alone
She wore scruffy jeans to the party
The scruffy apartment needed serious cleaning

definitions: extremely careful and thorough about details and accuracy
having strong moral principles and acting with complete integrity
examples: She kept scrupulous records of all transactions
The scientist was scrupulous in documenting results
His scrupulous honesty earned everyone's trust
The judge maintained scrupulous fairness throughout

definitions: shaped or formed by carving, modeling, or other shaping techniques
having well-defined muscles or body contours from exercise
examples: The sculpted marble statue stood in the garden
Sculpted figures adorned the ancient temple
His sculpted abs showed hours of training
Her sculpted arms revealed dedicated workouts

definitions: resembling sculpture in form, especially having three-dimensional artistic quality
examples: The building's sculptural design won architectural awards
Her sculptural hairstyle attracted many compliments
The sculptural quality of the furniture was striking
These sculptural forms dominated the gallery space

definitions: shaped or carved with artistic skill into three-dimensional form
examples: The sculptured relief depicted ancient battles
Sculptured gardens surrounded the palace
Her sculptured features resembled classical beauty
The sculptured landscape showed human intervention

definitions: mean, contemptible, or deserving of scorn in behavior or character
examples: That was a scurvy trick to play on him
The scurvy knave stole from the poor
His scurvy behavior disgusted everyone present
They played a scurvy joke on their friend

definitions: transported or carried by ship across the sea
examples: Seaborne trade dominated the ancient economy
The seaborne invasion began at dawn
Most seaborne cargo arrives in containers
Seaborne commerce connects global markets

definitions: regularly traveling by sea, especially as an occupation
examples: The seafaring nation built a powerful navy
His seafaring ancestors were whalers
Seafaring traditions shaped the coastal culture
The seafaring life appealed to adventurers

definitions: designed or suitable for traveling on the sea
examples: The seagoing vessel weathered the storm
They purchased a seagoing yacht
His seagoing experience made him valuable
The seagoing fleet departed at sunrise

definitions: closed or secured against opening or tampering
officially confirmed or made final and unchangeable
examples: The sealed envelope contained confidential information
Keep medicines in sealed containers
Their sealed fate could not be changed
The sealed agreement bound both parties

definitions: having no visible seams or joins in construction
smooth and continuous, with no apparent gaps or transitions
examples: The seamless garment was beautifully constructed
The seamless steel tube resisted pressure
The software provides seamless integration with systems
They achieved seamless transition between scenes

definitions: dried up or withered, especially from exposure to heat
examples: The sear leaves crunched underfoot in autumn
Sear grass covered the drought-stricken field
The sear landscape showed effects of wildfire
His sear complexion revealed years of sun
